intro: Stachytarpheta guatemalensis var. lundelliana, commonly known as the Guatemalan ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for ornamental gardening in tropical and subtropical regions. Its foliage is often aromatic and can be used in traditional herbal remedies.
